intro: Leucocoma dasycarpa, commonly known as the woolly-fruited leucocoma, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, spherical fruit clusters that are covered in dense white pubescence. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky or sandy soils. Its leaves are compound, with a distinctive pinnate structure, and it produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. The species is noted for its ecological importance in supporting pollinators and contributing to soil stabilization in its native habitat.
